alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 08 at 1:34PM MST until March 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with 5 to 9 inches for the northern portions of the Ogden Valley. * WHERE...In Utah, the Wasatch Back, especially the Ogden Valley. In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming including the I-80 corridor. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. For Southwest Wyoming, patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulations on roadways will initially be heavily dependent on higher snowfall rates to overcome warm surface temperatures this afternoon. Heaviest snowfall is possible between 5 PM and 7 PM, but may increase in intensity as early as 3 PM. Snow will diminish quickly after midnight for the Wasatch Back, after 3 AM for Southwest Wyoming.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx. For winter road conditions from the Wyoming Department of Transportation, visit http://www.wyoroad.info or dial 511.
